ygData.messageBody:
hm..thnx for that info...but the point i ment was that u plan to make a big
event i thought...and that it should be in freeport..or is that info wrong?
the tunnel is familiar to me...i was once in ur beautiful city of neriak and
liked it very much.....btw i would like to group up sometimes with some
necros around lvl 14-17 to go to lavastorm and rock some monsters
there....so if somebody is interested please give me a tell...and write from
which timezone u are cause i am from germany and need to compare ur times
with mine...
info:

german time zone is 6 hours advanced from east coast time and 9 hours
advanced from west coast time zone...ok?

agedon, lvl 15 necromancer of the beautyful city of akkon....

"the path of the dark is covered by lots of fallen by their feet, they dont
make them stumble, just smile....about their deeds"

-----Ursprï¿½ngliche Nachricht-----
Von: Mark Bourland [mailto:bourland@...]
Gesendet am: Montag, 14. Juni 1999 20:17
An: Bristlebane_EQ@onelist.com
Betreff: Re: [Bristlebane_EQ] AW: [Bristlebane_EQ] AW: [Bristlebane_EQ]
possible weekly trade f estival...

From: "Mark Bourland" <bourland@...>

>sure i have invisibility, but the prob is, when i am invis.how can we start
>a trade or something like that??not all char have infravison and see
>invisible or?thats the point i mean...


In the tunnel from North Ro to East Commonlands, there is no danger for a
necromancer by NPCs. I am a Dark Elf Necromancer and go at will between the
two zones via this tunnel. I've even traded with the only NPC there and
have not been attacked. A gnome such as yourself should be more liked than
me, thus I don't think you should have any problem. Thus your only concern
is getting through Freeport to the tunnel, which isn't very hard either. If
you have Gather Shadows, then use it and you won't have to worry about
guards or any other Freeport citizen. Head south from the South gate of
Freeport (actually within East Freeport zone) and enter North Ro, then
follow the right zone wall and you'll find the tunnel easily. Keep going
until you find an open area with the Swashbuckler inside (and hopefully
everyone else that is there to trade). The alternate route is to stay
invisible and make your way from East Freeport to West Freeport and then to
East Commonlands where you can follow the left zone wall and you'll find the
tunnel inset in a hill. Shouldn't be too hard.

-Kendrath
